  • Uses of Position in edu.citadel.compiler

    Methods in edu.citadel.compiler that return Position
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Position
    Source.getCharPosition()
    Returns the position (line number, char number) of the current character in the source file.
    Position
    AbstractToken.getPosition()
    Returns the token's position within the source file.
    Constructors in edu.citadel.compiler with parameters of type Position
    Modifier
    Constructor
    Description
     
    AbstractToken(Symbol symbol, Position position, String text)
    Constructs a new token with the given symbol, position, and text.
     
    CodeGenException(Position position, String errorMsg)
    Construct a code generation exception with the specified position and error message.
     
    CompilerException(String errorType, Position position, String errorMsg)
    Construct a compiler exception with information about the compilation phase, position, and error message.
     
    ConstraintException(Position position, String errorMsg)
    Construct a constraint exception with the specified position and error message.
     
    InternalCompilerException(Position position, String errorMsg)
    Construct an internal compiler exception with the specified error message and position.
     
    ParserException(Position position, String errorMsg)
    Construct a ParserException with the specified position and error message.
     
    ScannerException(Position position, String errorMsg)
    Construct a scanner exception with the specified position and error message.

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Position
    Declaration.getPosition()
    Returns the position of this declaration, which is simply the position of the identifier token.
    Position
    Expression.getPosition()
    Returns the position of this expression.

    Modifier
    Constructor
    Description
     
    AssignmentStmt(Variable variable, Expression expr, Position assignPosition)
    Construct an assignment statement with a variable, an expression, and the position of the assignment symbol.
     
    Expression(Position position)
    Construct an expression with the specified position.
     
    Expression(Type type, Position position)
    Construct an expression with the specified type and position.
     
    ReturnStmt(SubprogramDecl subprogramDecl, Expression returnExpr, Position returnPosition)
    Construct a return statement with a reference to the enclosing subprogram and the expression for the value being returned, which may be null.
     
    Variable(VariableDecl decl, Position position, List<Expression> selectorExprs)
    Construct a variable with a reference to its declaration, its position, and a list of selector expressions.
